p: The NHL land sink is approximately 2.5 times larger than the Arctic Ocean sink, on an annual basis. However, in terms of the change in carbon sink between the mid-1970s and early-2000s, the increase in CO 2 uptake by the land is about 15 times larger than the ocean. Accordingly, the Arctic Ocean can be ignored when trying to explain changes during the recent past, i.e., BRW period of CO 2 concentration measurements.
